result.execSummary:
The defendant William J. Ames was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With huber/work release and 24 days credit (stipulated to) in the event of revocation.

Conditions: 

16 days conditional jail time with work release privileges.  (* JOC AMENDED 8-25-15:  Judge Sharp clarifies that jail was to begin August 24, 2015.)

Attend, pay for and successfully complete domestic abuse counseling.

Attend, pay for and successfully complete any counseling or educational programs as provided by agent.

AODA assessment and follow through. 

No contact with victims. 

$160 restitution to be paid to probation for ML.  

Pay costs of action and costs of probation.  (If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.)

Defendant is not to possess or consume alcohol.  Must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is not to enter into any bars/taverns or establishment where the sale of alcohol is the primary business. 

DNA sample to be provided at the Richland County Sheriff's Department. Def to pay the surcharge. 

Parties stipulate to 24 days credit in the event of revocation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William J. Ames

defendant.name: Ames, William J.
defendant.address: 1292 W. Seminary St., Richland Center, WI 53581

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Letter from ML re: no contact order & reply from Judge: Copies to DA and Atty M for review/action. No further action by clerk at this time.

Defendant William J. Ames in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached resolution. Atty M. recites plea agreement. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights is presented. Colloquy. No contest plea entered. Finding of guilty. DA reads victim statement into record.  

Sentencing: 2 years probation imposed and stayed with 9 months jail with Huber privileges.  Conditions: 16 days conditional jail time with work release privileges. Attend, pay for and successfully complete domestic abuse counseling. Attend, pay for and successfully complete any counseling or educational programs as provided by agent. AODA assessment and follow through. No contact with victims. $160 restitution to be paid to probation for ML. Pay costs of action and costs of probation. Def is not to possess or consume alcohol/absolute sobriety. Defendant is not to enter into any bars/taverns or establishment where the sale of alcohol is the primary business. DNA sample and surcharge. Parties  stipulate to 24 days credit in the event of revocation.

Defendant William J. Ames in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Formal reading waived.  Court states possible max. penalties.  Atty. M asks for reconsideration on bail; asks for release on signature bond.  DA objects.  Court denies the request to modify bond.  NG plea entered.  Status set.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No contact with ML or her residence.  No contact with juveniles JTL 2-25-08 or ARL 11-5-09.  No drink.  No taverns.  Test on demand.  No possession of weapons.
